page.title: 02General Description 2
page.content: under the protection of the National Trust. The late 19th century saw a dramatic change in the area.Coal was known to be present at depths of between 800 and 1200ft.Amine was sunk, with great difficulty, and by the turn of the century the first coal had been mined by Horden Colliery.The colliery and its outbuildings dominate the northern part of the project area.At first the waste from the mine was tipped beside the colliery but very soon it was decided to tip the waste over the cliffs and onto the beach.This waste covered a very geologically valuable area because{ {Trechmann,}a prominent geologist had discovered Scandinavian rock in the glacial deposits along the seashore but these were covered with waste before a proper glacial survey could
